intro: Rodriguezia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian rodriguezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
